pullRequest.body:
Extracted from #21433.

---

I'm planning to extract just the "new enorm lemmas" part of that PR, so these helper lemmas might not be needed for *my* PR: they seem worth having anyway, though.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [af6b3e937c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22049/commits/af6b3e937cf9a2bea77f2c4ff9ad34b3aa80ad9d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ rpow_ofNNReal`
`+ toNNReal_natCast_eq_toNNReal`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks for the detailed review! I'm happy to learn more, and gladly a fast response in exchange for many comments.

This is ready for review again (except for possible further deprecation warnings downstream, which CI will tell about).

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13424264206/job/37503896901)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13425052874/job/37506288151)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13425052874/job/37506288411)

otherwise (after also fixing the PR title):

bors d+
I'm afraid you fell victim to the fact that tiny PRs can be reviewed in excruciating detail :)
I'm afraid you fell victim to the fact that tiny PRs can be reviewed in excruciating detail :)

otherwise (after also fixing the PR title):

bors d+
I think this should use the `^` notation rather than `.rpow`, no?
Nit: `n` is more common than `N` for natural arguments
I don't think `Nat.cast` needs to be written out; `(N : 0).toNNReal = (N : ).toNNReal` works

Perhaps:
```suggestion
  rw [Real.toNNReal_of_nonneg (by positivity), ENNReal.toNNReal_nat, mk_natCast]
```
This seems very specific, maybe too much so.
I'm happy to remove this. If another reviewer says do, I'll do it!
Agreed, this (`Nat.rpow_mul_toNNReal`) is too specific and should be removed.
Removed!

If `NNReal.toNNReal_coe_nat` is marked with `norm_cast`, this could also be
```suggestion
  rw [Real.toNNReal_mul (by positivity)]
  norm_cast
```
Happy to do so: do others believe the lemma should be marked `norm_cast`?
I think this should stay right next to `toReal_nat`
I'm not sure about this name - maybe `ENNReal.toNNReal_natCast_eq_toNNReal`? (`ENNReal.toNNReal_natCast` is what `ENNReal.toNNReal_nat` above should be called.)
I have renamed the lemmas accordingly, and also done the same for `ENNReal.to{Real,NNReal}_nat`
I [asked on zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Naming.20convention/near/500597665), to be more certain. Ok, seems like a dependent PR to prepare...
#22071 did this

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: two lemmas about (E)NNReal
